what I want to kind
of get at here is to really get feedback
from you folks in terms of your

and is from a feature set perspective is
this something that we should be doing
in the Upstream Argo community so when
you look back at CI back in 2010 the
early days back in the Jenkins hunson
days yes I'm that old uh the CI tool
essentially did it all right but now
with the Advent of G offs and all the

capabilities they bring what we're

CD and using CI for what it's good at
and using CD for what it's good at and
that's bring a lot of benefits but even
though the process and what we're doing
is evolved as Jesse noted in his own
keynote we're still kind of doing the
same things the same way right I change
my source code I build an image I push
it out to a deployment it's a very
point-by-point deployment by deployment
type process I uh update my Dev manifest
I update my stage manifest update my
prod manifest I test that particular
deployment that I'm doing but I'm not
looking at things holistically when I'm
doing
that and this brings a lot of challenges
that we see at our customers at Red Hat
one of the bigger ones for me really is
about coordinating changes so you know
I'm doing a new image update I'm
deploying new source code but it needs a
config Map update it needs a secret
update to go with it right and I wanted
deploy them at the exact same time when
I start rolling them through the
different environments how do I do that
the CI tool is automating source code
changes and it's automating all that but
it knows nothing about what the human
has to do in terms of updating things to
be compliant and make that work the
other thing that comes into play is uh
dependent applications testing and there
was an earlier question about this in my
uh previous session you know I've got a
couple of different applications that
are depend on each other and I want to
test them and deploy them more
holistically you know if we lived in the
world with rainbows and unicorns where
microservices were per perfect and
they're infinitely backwards and
forwards compatible and you could always
just test that and never worry about it
things would be great but unfortunately
that's not the world we live in for the
most part most Enterprises while some do
can do that it's not always the case
where that's possible and you are going
to have these dependencies where you
want to manage these things more uh
together so like when I deploy app one I
don't want to just test app one I want
to test that app two will still work
with app one and when you look at Argo
CD in terms of our levels of
abstraction right now we have
applications yes there's applications
sets on top of that in terms of grouping
those applications but really the
question I want to pose is do we need
more or a different level obstruction to
go along with those applications at the
lower end you know you can have the
concept of components we kind of address
that with customized components umbrella
charts and hel but the higher L you're
looking at things more holistically do
we need something like environment
snapshots something that represents more
of what you're deploying to from a
Target but something that's more
holistic than a single
application
and that's really where we're coming
from this perspective is looking at
things more holistically and how do we
do Whole environment promotion or maybe
snapshot promotion right where you can
have related items be able to manage
them effectively and efficiently deploy
them together right and then as you move
through Dev stage prod essentially be
able to test each of those environments
in turn from a more holistic perspective
rather than a point test that you do for
particular deployment that you may be
rolling out at that point of view now
from this approach point of view there's
definitely some pros and cons you know
the pro perspective is you're testing
things more as a unit moving things as a
unit which is great the con though is
that obviously if you've got a 100
different microservices that could be a
lot of testing and a lot of time to do
all that testing and slowing down your
CI process right so there's pros and
cons to this approach and what that
bright level of granularity in terms of
defining that superset over applications
is something I'm quite interested in
hearing from you folks as we go through
